title: Tsitsipas butt of jokes as Murray aims jibe in toilet break row
description: Stefanos Tsitsipas finds himself the butt of the jokes at the US Open after Andy Murray aims another jibe at the Greek third seed in the row over long bathroom breaks.

title: Wildlife photo: Is this the world's most beautiful mosquito?
description: Both beauty and beast. A Sabethes mosquito is visually stunning but it's also a carrier of disease.

title: Marseille drugs: Child victims of French city's vicious gang war
description: A 14-year-old is the latest victim of Marseille's gang war, prompting a key visit from President Macron.

title: Gulf Sky: 'Our ship was hijacked and taken to Iran'
description: Former crew of the oil tanker Gulf Sky talk publically for the first time about the ship's disappearance.

title: Why was this athlete 'too tall' to race?
description: Blake Leeper fought to compete with able-bodied athletes, but his blades were deemed too long.

title: Afghanistan: The questions facing Foreign Secretary Dominic Raab
description: The foreign secretary will be grilled by MPs on the UK's withdrawal from Afghanistan.

title: Football fan credits daughter with changing his racist beliefs
description: Football fan Neil says he changed his attitude with the help of his daughter, Millie.

title: Afghanistan: UK embassy told Afghans to go to Abbey Gate before suicide attack
description: Despite an attack being expected, emails seen by the BBC show embassy staff directing Afghans to the gate.

title: Liverpool man trapped in Afghanistan pleads for help
description: The Liverpool taxi driver travelled to the country about two weeks ago to help his family flee.

title: Female journalist who interviewed Taliban flees
description: Beheshta Arghand, who made headlines when she interviewed the Taliban, has spoken out after fleeing the country.

title: Amid violent reprisals, Afghans fear the Taliban's 'amnesty' was empty
description: Reports suggest the Taliban are searching for, and allegedly killing, people they pledged to leave in peace.

title: Afghanistan: How many refugees are there and where will they go?
description: Thousands of people are scrambling to flee Afghanistan after the Taliban took control of the country.

title: Afghanistan: 'Struggle to survive or race to escape' on streets of Kabul
description: The BBC's Lyse Doucet reports from the Afghan capital, a day after the last US troops left.

title: What equipment was left behind by US forces?
description: As US troops took off from Kabul, they abandoned 73 aircraft - all disabled.

title: E10 petrol: What is it and can my car run on it?
description: A more eco-friendly petrol is coming to filling stations - but it's not suitable for all cars.

title: Dave Grohl performs with Nandi Bushell, 11, at Foo Fighters gig
description: Nandi Bushell joins the American rock band on stage in Los Angeles.

title: Sarah Rainsford: My last report before Russian expulsion
description: The BBC's Moscow correspondent files her final despatch after more than 20 years reporting in Russia.

title: Afghanistan: Dominic Raab says UK must face new Taliban reality
description: The foreign secretary says the number of UK nationals still in Afghanistan is in the "low hundreds".

title: Geronimo the alpaca killed as legal row ends
description: A destruction order is carried out on the alpaca that tested positive for bovine TB.

title: Swimmer Dunn sets world record to win third gold of Tokyo Games - day seven round-up
description: Reece Dunn sets a new world record to win his third gold medal of the Tokyo Paralympics, as the medals continue to flow for Great Britain on day seven.

title: Tokyo Paralympics: Afghanistan athlete Hossain Rasouli makes debut after evacuation
description: Afghanistan evacuee Hossain Rasouli finally gets his chance to compete at the Tokyo Paralympics - and his opponents can't "help but feel joy".

title: 'Sir Alex, this one is for you' - Ronaldo re-signs for Manchester United
description: Cristiano Ronaldo says he is "back where I belong" at Manchester United and dedicates his return to the club to former boss Sir Alex Ferguson.

title: Mission: Impossible Covid shutdowns prompt lawsuit
description: Film maker Paramount alleges insurance payout for the latest Tom Cruise installment does not cover losses.

title: Tottenham agree £26m fee for Barcelona defender Emerson
description: Tottenham agree a £26m fee with Barcelona to sign Brazil right-back Emerson Royal.

title: Naked Attraction London bus ads to be removed
description: The advert was criticised on social media as "tone deaf" with passengers at risk of sexual assault.

title: The best of British press photography
description: Images from an exhibition of the best 100 from members of the British Press Photographers' Association.

title: PC Harper's widow vows to continue push for law change
description: Lissie Harper says she will not allow her Harper's Law campaign to be 'kicked into the long grass'.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo: How Man Utd pulled off shock transfer
description: BBC Sport's Simon Stone details the journey of Cristiano Ronaldo's shock return to Manchester United.

title: Toyko Paralympics: Sarah Storey wins 16th gold after C5 time trial victory
description: Watch the moment Sarah Storey became Britain's joint-most successful Paralympic athlete, winning the women's C5 time trial to earn her 16th gold medal.

title: Greta Thunberg: Scotland not a world leader on climate change
description: The activist, speaking ahead of Glasgow's COP26 summit, says no country in the "global north" is doing enough.

title: Mass rescue of 17 caught in rip current off Bournemouth
description: The group were seen by lifeguards being pulled out to sea in a powerful rip current on Monday.

title: Transfer deadline day: Summer window set to close
description: As the summer transfer window comes to a close, Tuesday is deadline day in the UK and Europe.

title: Tokyo Paralympics: Sarah Storey becomes Great Britain's joint most successful Paralympian with 16th gold
description: Sarah Storey becomes Great Britain's joint most successful Paralympian of all time after winning her 16th gold medal in the C5 time trial in Tokyo.

title: Afghanistan: Last US military flight departs ending America's longest war
description: The US military's last C17 aircraft left Kabul with the ambassador on board early on Tuesday.

title: Newspaper headlines: 'Fury' and 'chaos' as last US flight leaves Kabul
description: The front pages focus on Afghanistan, as US troops end their 20-year presence in the country.

title: Murray 'lost respect' for Tsitsipas during five-set defeat in US Open
description: Andy Murray says he "lost respect" for third seed Stefanos Tsitsipas during a feisty US Open match where the Briton accused his opponent of "cheating" by taking lengthy bathroom breaks.

title: The last US soldier leaves Afghanistan
description: Major General Chris Donahue was last aboard the final flight before the Taliban took Kabul airport.

title: Afghanistan: ‘A new chapter has begun’ says US
description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken has been speaking about the end of America's withdrawal from Afghanistan.
